Dear Lauryn Ritchie:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 5/22/2024. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area manager at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,
Paul Fatato, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• It was discussed that the facility needs to develop the new program as soon as
possible to provide a service to the DD/CI population.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No consultation was requested or required.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit and letter from their auditor.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator’s assessment identified there have been no required
corrective action plans during this reporting period and there have been no youth
in the program since 8/29/2022. The plan for the future use of the facility involves
beginning programing for the DD/CI population with a contract with the local CMH
for referrals. The Chief Administrator also notes there were no unplanned
discharges during this reporting period nor have policies or procedures been
changed.
Staff and Youth Interviews
There were no youth present, so youth interviews did not occur. However, three
staff (all administrators) were present and interviewed. All three report a desire to
open the program within this year with a focus on providing services to the DD/CI
population. They report there being a need for this service and the experience at
another facility have given them the knowledge to be successful in this type of
programing.
Description of Agency Walk Through
This is an older two-story facility in a residential neighborhood next to the Western
Michigan University campus. Although, the facility is older, they are providing
appropriate maintenance to keep it in fair repair. The facility is furnished
approximately in all aspects such as the kitchen, living room, dining room, and

bedrooms. All plumbing is in working order and the system of locking items is
appropriate.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
